channel.title: Adding Java Applet To Java Application? [help]
channel.description:
I would like to add a java applet to a java application... ( you know what im talking about by now... ) Help please?
I was thinking about making it extend Canvas instead of Applet, but then there would be no Run method and all those methods that happen when you enter page, leave page, etc.
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Adding Java Applet To Java Application? [help]
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

As an additional resource, here’s an article I found that goes into a bit more depth than what I wrote…it also talks about creating your own AppletStub extension, but unless your applet requires info from the browser (or from you since you’re converting it into an application), you don’t need to go into that.

http://java.sun.com/developer/technicalArticles/Programming/TurningAnApplet/

Read full topic
item.source: Adding Java Applet To Java Application? [help]

item.title: Adding Java Applet To Java Application? [help]
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:2, topic:3460”]I answered this question in another thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,2900.0.html

It’s somewhat specific to that applet he posted, but it should basically cover what you want :)[/quote]

<3

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Java Applet To Java Application? [help]
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

When you get 100 errors, it normally means more because the compiler only prints up to 100 (And the usual reason for that is a missing bracket)

Read full topic
